Subject: Re: [junit] Test-friendly, but not caller-friendly?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=12653864; y=52QAx5e-_Q1-V3S0Re9TiYh-tczTlICTxoqZXiWLw2XosnGI

Michael Feathers wrote:

>> Interfaces have their place, but that place has been vastly overdrawn in 
>> the Java world. Most classes simply do not need more than one 
>> implementation.
>>
>>  
>>
> Unless you're testing.


I disagree with that too. :-) I much prefer to test the actual classes 
rather than mock classes. Doing so I often discover bugs that aren't at 
all what I expected and that would have been missed by mock testing. The 
thorniest bugs are often at the intersections between classes rather 
than in the classes themselves.

Like interfaces, mocks have their place; but also like interfaces, that 
place is often seen to be broader than it really is.


--

subject: Re: [junit] Test-friendly, but not caller-friendly?
